      static java.lang.String getProperty(java.lang.String relation)

      static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Resource> graphToMap(java.lang.String onto, org.apache.jena.query.Dataset d)
      This method converts the RDF graph to a hashmap mapping a resource name (String) to an object of the class Resource By querying the dataset using Sparql, each resource (subject) are mapped to literals (objects) that are related to it If the object is not a literal, the method 'getResourceRelations()' (see description) gets the literals linked to that resource and append it to the subject's list of objects
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      The main method receives a text file as input, and output the result of the matching It also outputs the
      static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> mapping(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Resource> onto1_elements, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Resource> onto2_elements)
      This methods finds the matching of each element of the first ontology in the second one For each resource in the first ontology, its objects list is compared to the objects list of all resources in the second ontology The comparison is done using by giving some scores if two objects are equal and if not calculate their similarity using a string similarity method.

    • Method Detail

      • graphToMap

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Resource> graphToMap(java.lang.String onto,
                                                                  org.apache.jena.query.Dataset d)
        This method converts the RDF graph to a hashmap mapping a resource name (String) to an object of the class Resource By querying the dataset using Sparql, each resource (subject) are mapped to literals (objects) that are related to it If the object is not a literal, the method 'getResourceRelations()' (see description) gets the literals linked to that resource and append it to the subject's list of objects

      • getProperty

        public static java.lang.String getProperty(java.lang.String relation)
        This method gets the relation's name without the ontology URI

      • mapping

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> mapping(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Resource> onto1_elements,
                                                                       java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Resource> onto2_elements)
        This methods finds the matching of each element of the first ontology in the second one For each resource in the first ontology, its objects list is compared to the objects list of all resources in the second ontology The comparison is done using by giving some scores if two objects are equal and if not calculate their similarity using a string similarity method. The aggregate score of the objects of the resources of the second ontology are recorded and the resource with the highest score is stored as the match of the first ontology resource. This method returns a map with keys the resources of the first ontology and values their corresponding resources in the second one.
